title: Big Society' and Drug Treatment - Exploring the client data of a drugs services provider to consider the role social networks may have in improving ou
abstractText:
This research will provide a preliminary investigation of data collected by Crime Reduction Initiatives (CRI), a large and established social care charity, with a view to building an evidence-base to further improve delivery and lessen the social harm of drug dependency. The work is designed around four key components:

  • Assembling and deriving a comparative dataset from paper based and electronic records containing treatment and offending behaviour data;
  • Analysing these data with the assistance of UPSI expertise;
  • Exposing the data to an audience of academics, service providers, police partners, health providers and community workers.Through this process we seek to develop possible future directions for understanding the roles and needs of social networks in achieving better outcomes and reducing social harm;
  • Make immediate remedial changes to CRIâ€™s data collection requirement.

The work is positioned to provide the basis for a wider and deeper partnership, that will provide a platform for future research and developing more effective drugs treatment practice.
